qas.question: How many boroughs are in NYC?
Where is the Bronx positioned among NYC boroughs?
What is unique about the Bronx's location?

answers.text: Of the five boroughs, the Bronx is the only one on the U.S. mainland

context: The Bronx /ˈbrɒŋks/ is the <a1_0>northernmost<a1_0/> of the <a0_0>five<a0_0/> boroughs (counties) of New York City in the state of New York, located south of Westchester County. Many bridges and tunnels link the Bronx to the island and borough of Manhattan to the west over and under the narrow Harlem River, as well as three longer bridges south over the East River to the borough of Queens. <a4_0>Of the five boroughs, the Bronx is the only one on the U.S. mainland<a4_0/> and, with a land area of <a3_0>42 square miles (109 km2)<a3_0/> and a population of <a2_0>1,438,159<a2_0/> in 2014, has the fourth largest land area, the fourth highest population, and the third-highest population density.
